description: I am implementing a real-time object detection system using YOLO to identify and classify surgical instruments, reducing the likelihood of retained instruments inside patients during operating procedures.
I develop interactive web features for the Michigan Daily's online platform, improving user engagement and digital storytelling.
I led weekly discussions and office hours for 25+ graduate students, teaching C++ fundamentals, object-oriented design, testing, and debugging strategies.

company: UMich Center for Healthcare Engineering & Patient Safety
description: I built Python simulations and analyzed CT scan workflows in collaboration with U-M faculty and Michigan Medicine Emergency Department leadeship to identify bottlenecks that contributed to long wait times. Our proposed improvements are projected to save 12,000+ hours annually. My team was awarded 2nd place at the 2025 UM-IOE Research Symposium!
